prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism has a slightly tapered shape, with the top being wider than the bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel to each other and perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The dimensions of the prism are 0.375x0.375x0.25 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles set to (0, 0, 0) and translation vector set to (0, 0, 0). 2. Start a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. 3. Draw the following lines, forming a closed loop: * Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.125, 0) * Line 2: (0.125, 0) to (0.125, 0.125) * Line 3: (0.125, 0.125) to (0.125, 0.25) * Line 4: (0.125, 0.25) to (0.125, 0.375) * Line 5: (0.125, 0.375) to (0, 0.375) * Line 6: (0, 0.375) to (0, 0) 4. Close the loop by connecting Line 1 to Line 6. 5. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.375. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using euler angles (0, 0, 0) and translation vector (0, 0, 0). 7. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.25 units. Part 2 Instructions Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom and a curved side. The model is centered on the white background. The dimensions are 0.625x0.625x0.125 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles (0, 0, 0) and translation vector (0.125, 0, 0). 2. Start a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. 3. Draw the following lines, creating two rectangles on different levels: * Rectangle 1 (Top): + Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.625, 0) + Line 2: (0.625, 0) to (0.625, 0.125) + Line 3: (0.625, 0.125) to (0, 0.125) + Line 4: (0, 0.125) to (0, 0) * Rectangle 2 (Bottom): + Line 5: (0, 0.25) to (0.625, 0.25) + Line 6: (0.625, 0.25) to (0.625, 0.375) + Line 7: (0.625, 0.375) to (0, 0.375) + Line 8: (0, 0.375) to (0, 0.25) 4. Close loops for each rectangle. 5. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.625. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using euler angles (0, 0, 0) and translation vector (0.125, 0, 0). 7. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.125 units. 8. Join the resulting solid with the previous part. Part 3 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, similar to Part 1 but with different dimensions. The dimensions of the prism are 0.625x0.625x0.25 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles (0, 0, 0) and translation vector (0.125, 0.125, 0). 2. Start</description>
